text:
239-229 Bowery, east side, south from Stanton Street, as seen from Prince Street. Also shown is Prince Street, at the N.W. corner of the Bowery. The view shows Gabel's Theatre, at Nos. 235-237 Bowery.

August 18, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Stanton Street

text:
(1)
Bowery, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Stanton Street. Also shown is Stanton Street, south side, east from but not including the Bowery, to Chrystie Street. October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a further view northward.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Stanton Street - Bowery

text:
(1)
Bowery, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Stanton Street. Also shown is Stanton Street, south side, east from but not including the Bowery, to Chrystie Street. October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a further view northward.

May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Stanton Street - Bowery

text:
2 to 16 Stanton Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of the Bowery. Nos. 4 to 8 are 3-story frame houses. In the foreground, is the Third Ave. Elevated Line.

May 9, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, showing a closer view of Nos. 2 to 8. Nos. 4 to 8 are 3-story frame houses.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies, Collection Museum of the City of New York.
title: Manhattan: Stanton Street - Bowery
